metadata.name: Bracelet X
metadata.description:
CRIMINAL DROP: 1/2 UNIQUE ITEMS

Pussy Riot activists and queer couple Lucy Stein and Maria Alyokhina have been put on trial for instigating mass protests in Moscow and sentenced to the “restriction of freedoms” — a fancy term for a house arrest. Masha and Lucy have cut off their ankle monitors, duped police surveillance and managed to cross the Russian border. Both are now on a Putin’s wanted list.

We’ve recreated Federal Penitentiary Service ankle tags — including the stickers girls decorated them with. These are our trophies from the fight with the government. We believe that fetters will be gone.

Lucy and Masha wore these bracelets for a year. Despite house arrest, Lucy and Masha had been arrested regularly for 15 days for no reason. Back in 2012, Masha served two years in prison for a punk-prayer “Mother Mary, drive Putin away”. 

Half of the profits will go to Ukrainians suffering from the war & Russian political prisoners repressed for the antiwar position.
